title: connection​
content: </> type connection = {Disconnect: (self: any) → ()} A connection object that can be used to disconnect the signal handler.

title: Disconnect​
content: </> connection:Disconnect() → () Disconnects the connection from the signal.

title: Connect​
content: </> signal:Connect() → () Connects a handler function to the signal.

title: DisconnectAll​
content: </> signal:DisconnectAll() → () Disconnects all handler functions from the signal.

title: Fire​
content: </> signal:Fire() → () Fires the signal with the given arguments.

title: Wait​
content: This is a yielding function. When called, it will pause the Lua thread that called the function until a result is ready to be returned, without interrupting other scripts. Yields </> signal:Wait() → () Waits for the signal to be fired and returns the arguments that were passed to the signal when it was fired.

title: signal:Once​
content: </> signal:signal:Once() → () Connects a handler function to the signal that will only be called once.
